qas.question: What is the shortened way of referring to thrombolysis?
PCI and what treatment must be performed within 90 to 120 minutes?
How long does the PCI procedure take?
What treatment is recommended after 24 hours?

plausible_answers.text: within 30 minutes of arrival to hospital

qas.question: When must ECG evidence be taken?

context: The main treatment for MI with ECG evidence of ST elevation (STEMI) include thrombolysis and percutaneous coronary intervention. <b3_0>Primary percutaneous coronary intervention (<b0_0>PCI<b0_0/>)<b3_0/> is the treatment of choice for STEMI if it can be performed in a timely manner. If PCI cannot be performed within <b2_0>90 to 120 minutes<b2_0/> then <b1_0>thrombolysis<b1_0/>, preferably <b4_0>within 30 minutes of arrival to hospital<b4_0/>, is recommended. If a person has had symptoms for 12 to 24 hours evidence for thrombolysis is less and if they have had symptoms for more than 24 hours it is not recommended.
